text: The 1991 Men's EuroHockey Nations Championship was the sixth edition of the Men's EuroHockey Nations Championship, the quadrennial international men's field hockey championship of Europe organized by the European Hockey Federation. It was held in Paris, France from 12 to 23 June 1991. Germany won their third title by defeating the two-time defending champions the Netherlands 3–1 in the final. England won the bronze medal by defeating the Soviet Union 2–1 in penalty strokes after the match finished 1–1 after extra time. ==Preliminary round== ===Pool A=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ===Pool B=== \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- \---- ==Classification round== ===Ninth to twelfth place classification=== ====9–12th place semi- finals==== \---- ====Eleventh place game==== ====Ninth place game==== ===Fifth to eighth place classification=== ====5–8th place semi-finals==== \---- ====Seventh place game==== ====Fifth place game==== ===First to fourth place classification=== ====Semi-finals==== \---- ====Third place game==== ====Final==== ==Final standings== # # # # # # # # # # # # ==See also== *1991 Women's EuroHockey Nations Championship ==References== Category:Men's EuroHockey Nations Championship EuroHockey Nations Championship EuroHockey Nations Championship Category:International field hockey competitions hosted by France Category:International sports competitions hosted by Paris EuroHockey Nations Championship Category:Field hockey at the Summer Olympics – Men's European qualification EuroHockey Nations Championship
